intro: Randia sambesiaca, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood or red sandalwood, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, aromatic wood and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its valuable wood, it is also known for its ecological and economic significance in its native regions.
